item.title: About
item.description: Presentation Hi there! I am a biophysicist in the Physical Microfluidics and Bioengineering lab at the Pasteur Institute in Paris. At the PμB we develop new microfluidic setups and quantitative tools to study complex biological phenomena, such as yeast DNA repair mechanisms or the bacterial SOS response. I have recently completed my PhD between the Pasteur Institute and the École polytechnique. My PhD project involved investigating cell-cell interactions in complex biological systems.
